Electrical Engineer Job at Aideplanet Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Aideplanet Consulting Limited is one of Africa’s leading human resources firm with keen interest in partnering with organizations to rebuild their HR structure and give every employee a focus and direction. We provide a comprehensive range of human resource services across different sectors to organizations who seek expertise solutions to their need.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer
Job Location: Ogba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 
     

            
    




	This is an office and field-based, cross-functionalrole - conducting feasibility studies, managing budgets and timelines, ensuring projects meet safety codes and client needs, and performing maintenance and testing.This work spans various industries, from single private building, corporate buildings to estate development ensuring the safe and efficient use of electricity.
	We need candidates who are self-driven, organised, act with honestyandintegrity, good communication skills/ a telephone manner and a team player.
	Working with executives to implement new business opportunities. Also to work hand-in hand with other engineers.


Key Responsibilities


	Testing; Analysis: Conduct tests, analyze results, and evaluate systems to ensure performance, safety, and reliability.
	Project Management:Oversee projects, including developing specifications, managing budgets, estimating costs, and ensuring projects are completed on time.
	Compliance & Safety:Ensure that all designs and installations comply with industry standards,
	safety regulations, and client requirements.
	Collaboration: Work with other engineers, technicians, Electricians, and cross-functional teams to integrate electrical systems and resolve technical issues.
	Maintenance & Support:Oversee installation, maintenance, and repair programs for electrical systems and equipment.
	Design; Development:Create technical designs and schematics for electrical systems, components, and equipment usingComputer-Aided Design(CAD) and other engineering software, Microsoft word,Excel and Outlook will be an added advantage.
	The job may require working on multiple projects with multiple deadlines at multiple locations.
	Company assets must be protected at times and not used for private or personal purposes
	The job requires great flexibility plus quick and critical reasoning is important and necessary.
	The job requires strict adherence to company policies and delivery of duties.
	Provided training to other staff when required.


Requirements


	You must be a degree (or HND with 1-3 experience) holder in any one of the following disciplines: Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering,
	People skills: Must have excellent communication skills, be goal focused and well
	organised; act with honesty and integrity.
	Confidentiality is of paramount and it’s demanded at all times. All staff must demonstrate
	ability to this.
	A self-starter.
	Smartphone is compulsory, so is smart dressing.
	Driving License is necessary.


Salary
N150,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info.aideplanet@gmail.com using "Electrical Engineer" as the subject of the email.

Key Account Manager (Fragrance Chemicals) Job at Sunrose Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Sunrose Consulting Limited - Our client represents a major manufacturer of fragrance chemicals used in the production of cosmetics. The manufacturer is based in Europe. In order to ensure delivery of its focused growth strategy, the company now seeks to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Manager (Fragrance Chemicals)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Reporting to the Managing Director, you will be responsible for managing a portfolio of high-value accounts, driving revenue growth through account expansion, and ensuring exceptional customer satisfaction.
	As the Key Account Manager, you will serve as the primary point of contact for strategic clients, developing deep relationships with key stakeholders across multiple levels of their organisations.
	You will work closely with internal teams including sales, product development, customer success, and marketing to deliver comprehensive solutions that meet clients' evolving needs.
	In addition, you will establish a significant client base for the company, developing and maintaining a portfolio of leads by generating new businesses as well as exploiting existing opportunities.


Requirements


	Degree qualified (Graduates of Industrial Chemistry, Biochemistry or Chemistry will be an added advantage)
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in B2B account management, sales, or client relationship management (Experience in sales of chemicals or Fragrance will be an added advantage)
	Experience with CRM systems (Salesforce, HubSpot, or similar platforms)
	Strong negotiation skills with experience in complex, multi-stakeholder sales processes
	Excellent communication and presentation skills for C-level interactions
	Analytical mindset with ability to interpret data and create strategic recommendations
	Willingness to travel 25-40% for client meetings and industry events.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidate should send their Application Letter and CV to: info@sunroseconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Credit Control Officer Job at Lekki Freeport Terminal




        
    

        
        Lekki Freeport Terminal (LFT) operates as the container terminal at Lekki Deep Sea Port, which is Nigeria's first true deep-sea port and one of the most advanced maritime gateways in West Africa. Strategically positioned within the Lagos Free Zone in Ibeju-Lekki, LFT is dedicated to connecting global trade to Nigeria in a sustainable manner, utilising robust automation, digitisation, and innovation from the moment vessels board to the delivery of cargo while adhering to international safety standards.
     

            
    



The terminal takes advantage of deep water, with a draft of up to 16.5 m, and modern ship-to-shore capabilities, enabling it to accommodate large vessels and handle significant cargo volumes. This is part of a port complex designed to scale for millions of TEUs annually. The depth and infrastructure of the terminal contribute to reducing logistics costs and alleviating congestion along the Lagos corridor, establishing LFT as a key driver of regional trade growth. As Nigeria’s latest maritime gateway, LFT provides world-class port operations, integrating cutting-edge equipment, data-driven processes, and a culture of innovation to ensure faster, safer, and more reliable cargo flows for both shippers and shipping lines.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Credit Control Officer

Job Location: Ibeju Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Finance
Reporting to: Head of Accounts
Indirect Reporting to: CFO

Job Purpose


	To manage and monitor customer credit, ensure timely collection of outstanding debts, minimise bad debts, and maintain accurate credit records in line with company policies.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor customer accounts and ensure debts are collected within agreed credit terms
	Prepare and issue invoices, statements of account, and payment reminders
	Follow up on overdue payments through calls, emails, and formal letters
	Reconcile customer accounts and resolve billing discrepancies promptly
	Assess customer creditworthiness and recommend credit limits
	Maintain accurate records of credit transactions and collections
	Prepare aging analysis and credit control reports for management
	Liaise with sales and operations teams on credit-related matters
	Recommend accounts for suspension or legal action where necessary
	Ensure compliance with company credit policies and procedures


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Reduction in overdue receivables
	Collection efficiency ratio
	Accuracy of credit records
	Turnaround time for dispute resolution
	Compliance with credit policy


Qualifications & Experience


	HND/BSc in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field with 2–5 years of experience in credit control or accounts receivable
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA – added advantage)


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong negotiation and communication skills
	Good numerical and analytical ability
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
	High level of integrity and confidentiality

You will be expected to perform the following function:


	Manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure including printers & photocopiers
	Provide supports for network users
	Install, configure, test and maintain operating systems, application software and system management tools
	Setup and manage the messaging and collaborating system for enterprise use
	Proactively ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability
	Monitor and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions and work with developer’s vendors to implement those fixes
	Maintain security, backup, and redundancy strategies
	Provide 2nd level support for Microsoft Exchange users
	Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution.

	At least 2 years of related experience.
	Hands-on experience in computer systems installation, maintenance and troubleshooting
	Hands-on experience in managing active directory domain services
	Hands-on experience on various Microsoft Windows operating systems
	Hands-on experience in managing Microsoft exchange servers
	Good knowledge of data network
	Excellent written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
	Strong analytical and presentation skills with attention to detail
	Excellent team working skills
	Ability to work with minimal supervision
	Ability to deliver tasks with a very tight deadline.
	Ability to install and configure Local Area Network.
